card.name: Adder-Staff Boggart
card.ability: When Adder-Staff Boggart enters the battlefield, clash with an opponent. If you win, put a +1/+1 counter on Adder-Staff Boggart. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

card.name: Æthersnipe
card.ability:
When Æthersnipe enters the battlefield, return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
Evoke {1}{U}{U} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters the battlefield trigger on the stack in either order.

card.name: Ajani Goldmane
card.ability:
+1: You gain 2 life.
-1: Put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control. Those creatures gain vigilance until end of turn.
-6: Put a white Avatar creature token onto the battlefield. It has "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to your life total."
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : The vigilance granted to a creature by the second ability remains until the end of the turn even if the +1/+1 counter is removed.
10/1/2007 : The power and toughness of the Avatar created by the third ability will change as your life total changes.

card.name: Amoeboid Changeling
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
{T}: Target creature gains all creature types until end of turn.
{T}: Target creature loses all creature types until end of turn.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If a creature loses all creature types but then gains a new creature type later in the turn, it will be that new creature type.

card.name: Ancient Amphitheater
card.ability:
As Ancient Amphitheater enters the battlefield, you may reveal a Giant card from your hand. If you don't, Ancient Amphitheater enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: The arbiter Galanda Feudkiller judges Lorwyn's squabbles from a lofty perspective.

card.name: Aquitect's Will
card.ability: Put a flood counter on target land. That land is an Island in addition to its other types for as long as it has a flood counter on it. If you control a Merfolk, draw a card.
card.flavor: There is nowhere on Lorwyn that the Merrow Lanes cannot go.

card.name: Arbiter of Knollridge
card.ability:
Vigilance
When Arbiter of Knollridge enters the battlefield, each player's life total becomes the highest life total among all players.
card.flavor: Though giants are mortal, they live so long and on such a grand scale that many small folk don't believe they ever truly die.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : Abilities that trigger when a player gains life may trigger as a result of this ability.
10/1/2007 : In other multiplayer formats, each player's life total is set to the highest life total within his or her range of influence. These changes happen at the same time. For example, if each player has a range of influence of one, and the players in the game are Alice (4 life), Barry (8 life), Carrie (11 life), and Doug (7 life), in that order, then Alice's life total will become 8 and Barry and Doug's life totals will each become 11.
6/15/2010 : In a Two-Headed Giant game, each team chooses one person on that team to gain the appropriate amount of life. This basically means that the triggered ability will set the life total of each team to that of the team with the highest life total.

card.name: Ashling the Pilgrim
card.ability: {1}{R}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Ashling the Pilgrim. If this is the third time this ability has resolved this turn, remove all +1/+1 counters from Ashling the Pilgrim, and it deals that much damage to each creature and each player.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : "That much damage" refers to the number of +1/+1 counters removed from Ashling the Pilgrim.  Since the counters are removed, it’s likely that the damage will kill Ashling.
10/1/2007 : Counts resolutions, not activations. Any such abilities that are still on the stack won't count toward the total.
10/1/2007 : When the ability resolves, it counts the number of times that same ability from that this creature has already resolved that turn. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or the previous abilities when they resolved. A copy of this ability (created by Rings of Brighthearth, for example) will count toward the total. Abilities from other creatures with the same name don't count towards the total. Neither does an ability that's been countered.
10/1/2007 : You get the bonus only the third time the ability resolves. You won't get the bonus the fourth, fifth, sixth, or any subsequent times.

card.name: Ashling's Prerogative
card.ability:
As Ashling's Prerogative enters the battlefield, choose odd or even. (Zero is even.)
Each creature with converted mana cost of the chosen value has haste.
Each creature without converted mana cost of the chosen value enters the battlefield tapped.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : The "chosen value" is either "odd" or "even." So either creatures with odd converted mana costs enter the battlefield tapped and creatures with even converted mana costs have haste, or vice versa.
10/1/2007 : If a creature has X in its mana cost, that X is treated as 0 for the purposes of these effects. It doesn't matter what the value of X was while the creature was on the stack.

card.name: Auntie's Hovel
card.ability:
As Auntie's Hovel enters the battlefield, you may reveal a Goblin card from your hand. If you don't, Auntie's Hovel enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: The Stinkdrinker warren's hill of salvaged trinkets is large enough to cut a door in.

card.name: Austere Command
card.ability: Choose two — Destroy all artifacts; or destroy all enchantments; or destroy all creatures with converted mana cost 3 or less; or destroy all creatures with converted mana cost 4 or greater.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If the first and third modes are chosen, an artifact creature with converted mana cost 3 or less would be destroyed twice by this spell. It would have to be regenerated twice to survive. (A similar thing happens with most of the other combinations.)

card.name: Avian Changeling
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
Flying
card.flavor: Today it flies with the flock. Tomorrow it may wake to find them gone, its body in an unfamiliar form.

card.name: Axegrinder Giant
card.flavor: The angriest of giants are often the most skillful weaponsmiths. Their grudges fuel endless sessions at the forge, all the while growling ferociously to themselves.

card.name: Battle Mastery
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has double strike.
card.flavor:
"Boom Boom Boots the size of oxcarts, then an axe like a falling sun. Elves scattered. Trees scattered. Even the hills ran for the hills"
—Clachan Tales

card.name: Battlewand Oak
card.ability:
Whenever a Forest enters the battlefield under your control, Battlewand Oak gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Whenever you cast a Treefolk spell, Battlewand Oak gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

card.name: Benthicore
card.ability:
When Benthicore enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 blue Merfolk Wizard creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Tap two untapped Merfolk you control: Untap Benthicore. It gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

card.name: Black Poplar Shaman
card.ability: {2}{B}: Regenerate target Treefolk.
card.flavor: It absorbs the pain of other treefolk, which leaves it bitter, yet addicted to the sensation of agony.

card.name: Blades of Velis Vel
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
Up to two target creatures each get +2/+0 and gain all creature types until end of turn.
card.flavor: "The changing kind suffers as we do. We must join as one to quench our tyrants"

card.name: Blind-Spot Giant
card.ability: Blind-Spot Giant can't attack or block unless you control another Giant.
card.flavor: Among the solitude-loving giantkind, teamwork is unusual. But he appreciates hearing the occasional "Swing down and to your left."

card.name: Bog Hoodlums
card.ability:
Bog Hoodlums can't block.
When Bog Hoodlums enters the battlefield, clash with an opponent. If you win, put a +1/+1 counter on Bog Hoodlums. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

card.name: Boggart Birth Rite
card.ability: Return target Goblin card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Auntie excitedly held up the squalling newborn. "This one looks like Byoog Maybe he'll tell us what he saw and felt in the beyond."

card.name: Boggart Forager
card.ability: {R}, Sacrifice Boggart Forager: Target player shuffles his or her library.
card.flavor:
"Reach in this hole, lose a hand. Reach in that hole, find a sparkly."
—Auntie wisdom

card.name: Boggart Harbinger
card.ability: When Boggart Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Goblin card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

card.name: Boggart Loggers
card.ability:
Forestwalk
{2}{B}, Sacrifice Boggart Loggers: Destroy target Treefolk or Forest.
card.flavor: Auntie Flint lent axes to Nibb and Gyik, thinking they'd share their experiences with her. She's still waiting for them to come back.

card.name: Boggart Mob
card.ability:
Champion a Goblin (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another Goblin you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)
Whenever a Goblin you control deals combat damage to a player, you may put a 1/1 black Goblin Rogue creature token onto the battlefield.

card.name: Boggart Shenanigans
card.ability: Whenever another Goblin you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may have Boggart Shenanigans deal 1 damage to target player.
card.flavor: Boggarts revel in discovering new sensations, from the texture of an otter pellet to the squeak of a dying warren mate.

card.name: Boggart Sprite-Chaser
card.ability: As long as you control a Faerie, Boggart Sprite-Chaser gets +1/+1 and has flying.
card.flavor:
"Auntie pointed out to the faerie how much mischief a flying boggart could wreak, and a beautiful new friendship was born."
—A tale of Auntie Grub

card.name: Bog-Strider Ash
card.ability:
Swampwalk
Whenever a player casts a Goblin spell, you may pay {G}. If you do, you gain 2 life.
card.flavor: "If you want to test wisdom, offer it to fools and watch how they tear it up."

card.name: Briarhorn
card.ability:
Flash
When Briarhorn enters the battlefield, target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
Evoke {1}{G} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters the battlefield trigger on the stack in either order.

card.name: Brigid, Hero of Kinsbaile
card.ability:
First strike
{T}: Brigid, Hero of Kinsbaile deals 2 damage to each attacking or blocking creature target player controls.
card.flavor: Thanks to one champion archer, the true borders of Kinsbaile extend an arrow's flight beyond the buildings.

card.name: Brion Stoutarm
card.ability:
Lifelink
{R}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature other than Brion Stoutarm: Brion Stoutarm deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to target player.

card.name: Broken Ambitions
card.ability: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. Clash with an opponent. If you win, that spell's controller puts the top four cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : The opponent you clash with doesn't have to be the controller of the targeted spell.
10/1/2007 : The clash (and the result of the clash if you win) happens regardless of whether the targeted spell was countered or {X} was paid.

card.name: Burrenton Forge-Tender
card.ability:
Protection from red
Sacrifice Burrenton Forge-Tender: Prevent all damage a red source of your choice would deal this turn.
card.flavor: "We are a clachan of smiths. The forge is as comfortable to us as a small fire during a cool winter's evening."
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If the red source you chose changes colors before the damage is dealt, the damage-prevention effect doesn't apply.

card.name: Cairn Wanderer
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
As long as a creature card with flying is in a graveyard, Cairn Wanderer has flying. The same is true for fear, first strike, double strike, deathtouch, haste, landwalk, lifelink, protection, reach, trample, shroud, and vigilance.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : Cairn Wanderer's ability looks at all cards in all graveyards. It gains any landwalk abilities and any protection abilities.

card.name: Captivating Glance
card.ability:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of your end step, clash with an opponent. If you win, gain control of enchanted creature. Otherwise, that player gains control of enchanted creature. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : The ability triggers at the end of Captivating Glance's controller's turn. "You" refers to the controller of Captivating Glance, not the controller of the enchanted creature.
10/1/2007 : The opponent you clash with doesn't have to be the controller of the enchanted creature.
10/1/2007 : If you win the clash, you gain control of the enchanted creature (even if the other player won the clash too; this can happen if a split card is revealed). If you don't win the clash, the other player gains control of the enchanted creature (even if that player didn't win the clash either).
10/1/2007 : Captivating Glance's controller never changes as a result of this card.
10/1/2007 : Captivating Glance may cause a player to gain control of a creature he or she already controls. This layers a new control effect on that creature, but doing so rarely has any visible effect.
10/1/2007 : Captivating Glance's control-change effect continues to apply even if Captivating Glance leaves the battlefield.

card.name: Caterwauling Boggart
card.ability:
Each Goblin you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
Each Elemental you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
card.flavor:
"As far as I can tell, that frog dangling from the stick serves absolutely no purpose whatsoever."
—Gaddock Teeg
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : Each creature you control that's both a Goblin and an Elemental can't be blocked except by two or more creatures (as opposed to four or more creatures).

card.name: Ceaseless Searblades
card.ability: Whenever you activate an ability of an Elemental, Ceaseless Searblades gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Flamekins' fires burn cool until they decide otherwise.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : This triggers whenever you activate an activated ability of an Elemental permanent, but not when you activate an activated ability of an Elemental source that's not on the battlefield.

card.name: Cenn's Heir
card.ability: Whenever Cenn's Heir attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each other attacking Kithkin.
card.flavor: His home clachan's familial spirit bolsters his own, but he will be ready to preside over the town as cenn only after he learns to project that strength to others.

card.name: Chandra Nalaar
card.ability:
+1: Chandra Nalaar deals 1 damage to target player.
-X: Chandra Nalaar deals X damage to target creature.
-8: Chandra Nalaar deals 10 damage to target player and each creature he or she controls.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : To activate the second ability, you choose a value of X equal to or less than the number of loyalty counters on Chandra Nalaar. You may choose 0. You can't choose a negative number.

card.name: Changeling Berserker
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
Haste
Champion a creature (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another creature you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)

card.name: Changeling Hero
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
Champion a creature (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another creature you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

card.name: Changeling Titan
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
Champion a creature (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another creature you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)

card.name: Cloudcrown Oak
card.ability: Reach (This can block creatures with flying.)
card.flavor:
"Clever folk build their homes near cloudcrowns. If a hawk or even just a faerie tries to swoop in, it'll get swatted from here to Cloverdell."
—Calydd, kithkin farmer

card.name: Cloudgoat Ranger
card.ability:
When Cloudgoat Ranger enters the battlefield, put three 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Tap three untapped Kithkin you control: Cloudgoat Ranger gets +2/+0 and gains flying until end of turn.

card.name: Cloudthresher
card.ability:
Flash
Reach (This can block creatures with flying.)
When Cloudthresher enters the battlefield, it deals 2 damage to each creature with flying and each player.
Evoke {2}{G}{G} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters the battlefield trigger on the stack in either order.

card.name: Colfenor's Plans
card.ability:
When Colfenor's Plans enters the battlefield, exile the top seven cards of your library face down.
You may look at and play cards exiled with Colfenor's Plans.
Skip your draw step.
You can't cast more than one spell each turn.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : The turn you cast Colfenor's Plans, you have cast (at least) one spell that turn. After it enters the battlefield and its last ability goes into effect, you can't cast any more spells that turn.
10/1/2007 : Playing a card exiled with Colfenor's Plans follows all the normal rules for playing that card. You must pay its costs, and you must follow all timing restrictions, for example.
10/1/2007 : If an exiled card has morph, you may cast it face down.
4/15/2013 : If Colfenor's Plans leaves the battlefield, you can continue to look at cards exiled by it, but you can no longer play them.

card.name: Colfenor's Urn
card.ability:
Whenever a creature with toughness 4 or greater is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may exile it.
At the beginning of the end step, if three or more cards have been exiled with Colfenor's Urn, sacrifice it. If you do, return those cards to the battlefield under their owner's control.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : The second ability checks how many creatures have been exiled with Colfenor's Urn over the course of the entire game.
10/1/2007 : The second ability forces you to sacrifice Colfenor's Urn. If the ability triggers and the Urn isn't sacrificed (because it left the battlefield or changed controllers, for example), the exiled cards won't be returned to the battlefield.
10/1/2007 : The first ability triggers when a token creature with toughness 4 or greater is put into your graveyard. However, that token will cease to exist before Colfenor's Plans can exile it.

card.name: Consuming Bonfire
card.ability: Choose one — Consuming Bonfire deals 4 damage to target non-Elemental creature; or Consuming Bonfire deals 7 damage to target Treefolk creature.
card.flavor:
"The elves use treefolk to drive us away. It is time to remove their tools."
—Vessifrus, flamekin demagogue

card.name: Crib Swap
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
Exile target creature. Its controller puts a 1/1 colorless Shapeshifter creature token with changeling onto the battlefield.

card.name: Crush Underfoot
card.ability: Choose a Giant creature you control. It deals damage equal to its power to target creature.
card.flavor:
Five-toed grave
—Kithkin phrase meaning
"a giant's footprint"

card.name: Cryptic Command
card.ability: Choose two — Counter target spell; or return target permanent to its owner's hand; or tap all creatures your opponents control; or draw a card.

card.name: Dauntless Dourbark
card.ability:
Dauntless Dourbark's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control plus the number of Treefolk you control.
Dauntless Dourbark has trample as long as you control another Treefolk.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : Dauntless Dourbark counts itself when determining its power and toughness.
10/1/2007 : A permanent that's both a Forest and a Treefolk will be counted twice when determining Dauntless Dourbark's power and toughness.

card.name: Dawnfluke
card.ability:
Flash
When Dawnfluke enters the battlefield, prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
Evoke {W} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters the battlefield trigger on the stack in either order.

card.name: Deathrender
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +2/+2.
Whenever equipped creature dies, you may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield and attach Deathrender to it.
Equip {2}
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If the creature you put onto the battlefield can't be equipped by Deathrender (due to protection from artifacts, for example), the creature enters the battlefield but Deathrender remains unattached.

card.name: Deeptread Merrow
card.ability: {U}: Deeptread Merrow gains islandwalk until end of turn.
card.flavor: "My success at navigating the Dark Meanders irritates the Inkfathom school. They consider themselves peerless divers, but I try to remind them that they cannot own commodities like bravery and cunning."

card.name: Dolmen Gate
card.ability: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to attacking creatures you control.
card.flavor: Lorwyn's stones resonate with the place from which they were hewed. Though taken far, still they call to their home when silence is upon the land.

card.name: Doran, the Siege Tower
card.ability: Each creature assigns combat damage equal to its toughness rather than its power.
card.flavor: "Each year that passes rings you inwardly with memory and might. Wield your heart, and the world will tremble."
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : Doran's ability means, for example, that a 2/3 creature will assign 3 damage in combat instead of 2.
10/1/2007 : Doran's ability doesn't actually change creatures' power; it changes only the value of the combat damage they assign. All other rules and effects that check power or toughness use the real values.
10/1/2007 : This effect is mandatory and affects all creatures.

card.name: Dread
card.ability:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Whenever a creature deals damage to you, destroy it.
When Dread is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : The last ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into its owner's graveyard from any zone, not just from on the battlefield.
10/1/2007 : Although this ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it doesn't *specifically* trigger on leaving the battlefield, so it doesn't behave like other leaves-the-battlefield abilities. The ability will trigger from the graveyard.
10/1/2007 : If the Incarnation had lost this ability while on the battlefield (due to Lignify, for example) and then was destroyed, the ability would still trigger and it would get shuffled into its owner's library.  However, if the Incarnation lost this ability when it was put into the graveyard (due to Yixlid Jailer, for example), the ability wouldn't trigger and the Incarnation would remain in the graveyard.
10/1/2007 : If the Incarnation is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, it won't get shuffled into its owner's library. Similarly, if a replacement effect has the Incarnation move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.

card.name: Dreamspoiler Witches
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever you cast a spell during an opponent's turn, you may have target creature get -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: At night, the faeries steal dreamstuff for their queen. At daybreak, countless creatures wake weak and hollow.

card.name: Drowner of Secrets
card.ability: Tap an untapped Merfolk you control: Target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.flavor: Merrows consider themselves the keepers of Lorwyn's past—and consider it their duty to edit when necessary.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : You can tap any permanent with the Merfolk creature type to pay for the ability, including noncreature tribal permanents such as Merrow Commerce.

card.name: Ego Erasure
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
Creatures target player controls get -2/-0 and lose all creature types until end of turn.
card.flavor: When all is taken away, all are equal.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If a creature loses all creature types but then gains a new creature type later in the turn, it will be that new creature type.

card.name: Elvish Branchbender
card.ability: {T}: Until end of turn, target Forest becomes an X/X Treefolk creature in addition to its other types, where X is the number of Elves you control.
card.flavor: "How do the vinebred feel? Fah We do not ask the puppet how it feels when the puppeteer bids it dance."
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : The value of X is determined when the ability resolves. It won't change later, even if the number of Elves you control changes.
10/1/2007 : If you control no Elves when the ability resolves, the Forest will become a 0/0 creature and be put into the graveyard. However, since Elvish Branchbender is itself an Elf, the Forest will usually be at least a 1/1.
8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Elvish Eulogist
card.ability: Sacrifice Elvish Eulogist: You gain 1 life for each Elf card in your graveyard.
card.flavor: "No matter how adept our artistic skill, our effigies can never hope to capture the vibrant beauty of a living elf. Perhaps that is truly why we mourn."
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : By the time this ability resolves, Elvish Eulogist will most likely be in your graveyard, so it will be counted by its own ability.

card.name: Elvish Handservant
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a Giant spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Elvish Handservant.
card.flavor: The hardest lesson for any elf to learn is humility. It takes a giant to teach that.

card.name: Elvish Harbinger
card.ability:
When Elvish Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Elf card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Elvish Promenade
card.ability: Put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield for each Elf you control.
card.flavor: The faultless and immaculate castes form the lower tiers of elvish society, with the exquisite caste above them. At the pinnacle is the perfect, a consummate blend of aristocrat and predator.

card.name: Entangling Trap
card.ability: Whenever you clash, tap target creature an opponent controls. If you won, that creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step. (This ability triggers after the clash ends.)

card.name: Epic Proportions
card.ability:
Flash
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +5/+5 and has trample.
card.flavor: From mite to mighty.

card.name: Ethereal Whiskergill
card.ability:
Flying
Ethereal Whiskergill can't attack unless defending player controls an Island.
card.flavor: Fallowsages debate whether the whiskergill is native to the Dark Meanders or merely dreamstuff made real.

card.name: Exiled Boggart
card.ability: When Exiled Boggart dies, discard a card.
card.flavor: Among the boggarts, there is only one real rule: all new treasures and experiences must be shared. Those who hoard their gifts commit the one truly unforgivable sin.

card.name: Eyeblight's Ending
card.ability: Destroy target non-Elf creature.
card.flavor:
"Those without beauty are Lorwyn's greatest tumor. The winnowers have an unpleasant duty, but a necessary one."
—Eidren, perfect of Lys Alana

card.name: Eyes of the Wisent
card.ability: Whenever an opponent casts a blue spell during your turn, you may put a 4/4 green Elemental creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor:
Calm as a wisent's watch
—Elvish expression meaning "safe"

card.name: Facevaulter
card.ability: {B}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Facevaulter gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Boggarts get so excited when they find something new to smash that they really don't notice who gets underfoot.

card.name: Faerie Harbinger
card.ability:
Flash
Flying
When Faerie Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Faerie card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

card.name: Faerie Tauntings
card.ability: Whenever you cast a spell during an opponent's turn, you may have each opponent lose 1 life.
card.flavor: Beneath the fae's constant pranks runs a subtler undercurrent of mockery: the influence of Oona, their hidden queen.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : You choose either to have each opponent lose 1 life or to have no opponent lose any life. You don't choose for each opponent individually.

card.name: Faerie Trickery
card.ability: Counter target non-Faerie spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.
card.flavor: The fae are so quick and their life spans so short that it's difficult to get retribution for their pranks.

card.name: Fallowsage
card.ability: Whenever Fallowsage becomes tapped, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: Memories of ages past are said to swim the minds of lounging fallowsages.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : This is a triggered ability, not an activated ability. It doesn't allow you to tap the creature whenever you want; rather, you need some other way of tapping it, such as by attacking with the creature.
10/1/2007 : For the ability to trigger, the creature has to actually change from untapped to tapped. If an effect attempts to tap the creature, but it was already tapped at the time, this ability won't trigger.

card.name: Familiar's Ruse
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Familiar's Ruse, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
Counter target spell.
card.flavor: Because of their capricious nature, faeries can serve as living lenses for disruptive magic.

card.name: Fathom Trawl
card.ability: Reveal cards from the top of your library until you reveal three nonland cards. Put the nonland cards revealed this way into your hand, then put the rest of the revealed cards on the bottom of your library in any order.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If there are fewer than three nonland cards in your library, you will reveal your entire library, put all nonland cards into your hand, and put the rest back in any order.

card.name: Faultgrinder
card.ability:
Trample
When Faultgrinder enters the battlefield, destroy target land.
Evoke {4}{R} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters the battlefield trigger on the stack in either order.

card.name: Favor of the Mighty
card.ability: Each creature with the highest converted mana cost has protection from all colors.
card.flavor:
"What does a mountain fear of a fly? Giants are barely aware of us, let alone afraid."
—Gaddock Teeg
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : If there's a tie for highest converted mana cost, all of those creatures have protection from all colors.
10/1/2007 : This effect is checked continuously. If a new creature enters the battlefield with the highest converted mana cost, it gains protection from all colors and the previous highest loses it.
10/1/2007 : If a creature has X in its mana cost, that X is treated as 0 for the purposes of this effect. It doesn't matter what the value of X was while the creature was on the stack.

card.name: Fertile Ground
card.ability:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds one mana of any color to his or her mana pool (in addition to the mana the land produces).
card.flavor: Pretty, valuable, and delicious—a boggart thief's trifecta.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The color of mana to be generated is chosen when tapping the land for mana.

card.name: Final Revels
card.ability: Choose one — All creatures get +2/+0 until end of turn; or all creatures get -0/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: One whiff of the sweet, pungent scent leads to euphoria—or to an early grave.

card.name: Fire-Belly Changeling
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
{R}: Fire-Belly Changeling gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
card.flavor:
"My ears say it hisses. My fingers say it burns."
—Auntie Wort

card.name: Fistful of Force
card.ability: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Clash with an opponent. If you win, that creature gets an additional +2/+2 and gains trample until end of turn. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

card.name: Flamekin Bladewhirl
card.ability: As an additional cost to cast Flamekin Bladewhirl, reveal an Elemental card from your hand or pay {3}.
card.flavor:
"The elves may try to confine us, but they will learn that our blazing spirit can never be suppressed."
—Vessifrus, flamekin demagogue

card.name: Flamekin Brawler
card.ability: {R}: Flamekin Brawler gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: When he hits people, they stay hit.

card.name: Flamekin Harbinger
card.ability: When Flamekin Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for an Elemental card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

card.name: Flamekin Spitfire
card.ability: {3}{R}: Flamekin Spitfire deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Some flamekin warriors explore the art of coherence, an ancient discipline that harnesses the chaos of fire and focuses it with pinpoint precision.

card.name: Fodder Launch
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Fodder Launch, sacrifice a Goblin.
Target creature gets -5/-5 until end of turn. Fodder Launch deals 5 damage to that creature's controller.
card.flavor: Leave it to a boggart to come up with a projectile as disgusting as it is deadly.

card.name: Footbottom Feast
card.ability:
Put any number of target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: The scent of rot and vinegar fills the marsh, inviting boggarts from every warren to reunite and feast.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : You choose the order of the cards you put on top of your library.
10/1/2007 : You can cast this with zero targets. If you do, you'll get to draw a card. However, if you cast this with at least one target and all of those targets become illegal, the spell will be countered and you won't get to draw a card.

card.name: Forced Fruition
card.ability: Whenever an opponent casts a spell, that player draws seven cards.
card.flavor:
"Petals within petals within petals, tadpole. The truth lurks below an opulence of illusion."
—Neerdiv, fallowsage
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : Yes, the opponent draws seven cards. It's not optional.

card.name: Gaddock Teeg
card.ability:
Noncreature spells with converted mana cost 4 or greater can't be cast.
Noncreature spells with {X} in their mana costs can't be cast.
card.flavor: So great is his wisdom and spirit that many who have met him say that they stood before a giant of a man and talked to the wisest of the four winds.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If one half of a split card has a converted mana cost of 3 or less and doesn't have an {X} in its mana cost, Gaddock Teeg lets you cast that half.

card.name: Galepowder Mage
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Galepowder Mage attacks, exile another target creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : Galepowder Mage's ability can target a creature controlled by any player. It's not optional.
10/1/2007 : The exiled card will be returned to the battlefield at the beginning of the end step even if Galepowder Mage is no longer on the battlefield at that time.
10/1/2007 : If Galepowder Mage is the only creature on the battlefield when it attacks, its ability has no effect.

card.name: Garruk Wildspeaker
card.ability:
+1: Untap two target lands.
-1: Put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.
-4: Creatures you control get +3/+3 and gain trample until end of turn.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : The first ability can target any two lands. They don't have to be tapped.
10/1/2009 : The third ability affects only creatures you control at the time it resolves. It won't affect creatures that come under your control later in the turn.

card.name: Ghostly Changeling
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
{1}{B}: Ghostly Changeling gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: In desolate places, changelings may take the shape of fancies, or memories, or fears.

card.name: Giant Harbinger
card.ability: When Giant Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Giant card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

card.name: Giant's Ire
card.ability: Giant's Ire deals 4 damage to target player. If you control a Giant, draw a card.
card.flavor: The only feeling greater than hurling something a mile is crushing something else with it that was really, really irritating you.

card.name: Gilt-Leaf Ambush
card.ability: Put two 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature tokens onto the battlefield. Clash with an opponent. If you win, those creatures gain deathtouch until end of turn. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost. Any amount of damage a creature with deathtouch deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

card.name: Gilt-Leaf Palace
card.ability:
As Gilt-Leaf Palace enters the battlefield, you may reveal an Elf card from your hand. If you don't, Gilt-Leaf Palace enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Dawn's Light, greatest palace of Gilt-Leaf Wood, is built on tiers of wood and power.

card.name: Gilt-Leaf Seer
card.ability: {G}, {T}: Look at the top two cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
card.flavor: Desmera blinded her seers so that her beauty would be the last image burned in their memories. The act only deepened their insight.

card.name: Glarewielder
card.ability:
Haste
When Glarewielder enters the battlefield, up to two target creatures can't block this turn.
Evoke {1}{R} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : You may choose zero, one, or two target creatures.
4/15/2013 : If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters the battlefield trigger on the stack in either order.

card.name: Glen Elendra Pranksters
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever you cast a spell during an opponent's turn, you may return target creature you control to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: Victims spirited through a faerie ring find themselves stranded miles away.

card.name: Glimmerdust Nap
card.ability:
Enchant tapped creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
card.flavor: The dreams of giants are as long as time and as deep as the earth. Thus they are prized by the dream-harvesting fae.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : Glimmerdust Nap can target only a tapped creature.
10/1/2007 : If the targeted creature has become untapped by the time Glimmerdust Nap would resolve, Glimmerdust Nap is countered for having an illegal target.
10/1/2007 : If the enchanted creature becomes untapped, Glimmerdust Nap is put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action.

card.name: Goatnapper
card.ability: When Goatnapper enters the battlefield, untap target Goat and gain control of it until end of turn. It gains haste until end of turn.
card.flavor: Kith goats are just for practice. The real prize, of course, is a giant's cloudgoat.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : Yes, target Goat. Goat is a creature type. Keep in mind that each permanent with changeling is a Goat, as is any permanent affected by a spell or ability that gives it every creature type.

card.name: Goldmeadow Dodger
card.ability: Goldmeadow Dodger can't be blocked by creatures with power 4 or greater.
card.flavor: "I've gotten close enough to a giant to smell his breath, but none has ever so much as spotted me. I wonder how long my record can extend?"
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : After Goldmeadow Dodger becomes blocked, increasing the blocking creature's power to 4 or greater has no effect on the block.

card.name: Goldmeadow Harrier
card.ability: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.
card.flavor:
"It's a proven fact that sling-stones from the dawn side of the riverbank sail the farthest and truest."
—Deagan, cenn of Burrenton

card.name: Goldmeadow Stalwart
card.ability: As an additional cost to cast Goldmeadow Stalwart, reveal a Kithkin card from your hand or pay {3}.
card.flavor: The thoughtweft ties a clachan together. Sharing each other's hopes and fears, all the village's citizens spring into action upon the first threat to any one of them.

card.name: Guardian of Cloverdell
card.ability:
When Guardian of Cloverdell enters the battlefield, put three 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.
{G}, Sacrifice a Kithkin: You gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Although they're protective of all creatures, many treefolk are especially fond of the empathic kithkin.

card.name: Guile
card.ability:
Guile can't be blocked except by three or more creatures.
If a spell or ability you control would counter a spell, instead exile that spell and you may play that card without paying its mana cost.
When Guile is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : Guile's second ability replaces "counter [a certain spell]" with "exile [a certain spell] and you may cast it without paying its mana cost." You have the option to cast it immediately upon its exile. If you choose not to, it remains exiled and you don't get another chance to cast it. If the spell or ability that tried to counter the spell has additional effects, it then continues to resolve.
10/1/2007 : Exiling the spell is mandatory. Casting it is not.
10/1/2007 : A spell exiled this way was never actually countered.
10/1/2007 : If a spell or ability you control attempts to counter a spell that can't be countered, it doesn't. Since the spell wouldn't be countered, Guile's ability has no effect on it. The spell will continue to resolve normally.
10/1/2007 : The last ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into its owner's graveyard from any zone, not just from on the battlefield.
10/1/2007 : Although this ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it doesn't *specifically* trigger on leaving the battlefield, so it doesn't behave like other leaves-the-battlefield abilities. The ability will trigger from the graveyard.
10/1/2007 : If the Incarnation had lost this ability while on the battlefield (due to Lignify, for example) and then was destroyed, the ability would still trigger and it would get shuffled into its owner's library.  However, if the Incarnation lost this ability when it was put into the graveyard (due to Yixlid Jailer, for example), the ability wouldn't trigger and the Incarnation would remain in the graveyard.
10/1/2007 : If the Incarnation is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, it won't get shuffled into its owner's library. Similarly, if a replacement effect has the Incarnation move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.

card.name: Hamletback Goliath
card.ability: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you may put X +1/+1 counters on Hamletback Goliath, where X is that creature's power.
card.flavor:
"If you live on a giant's back, there's only one individual you'll ever need to fear."
—Gaddock Teeg
card.ruling: 7/1/2012 : The value of X is determined as the ability begins resolving. If the other creature is no longer on the battlefield, its last known existence on the battlefield is checked to determine its power.

card.name: Harpoon Sniper
card.ability: {W}, {T}: Harpoon Sniper deals X damage to target attacking or blocking creature, where X is the number of Merfolk you control.
card.flavor: Made from whiskergill bones, merrow spinebows can fire bolts through tree trunks.

card.name: Heal the Scars
card.ability: Regenerate target creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
card.flavor: Elvish battle-magic has evolved two specialties: inflicting wounds that scar, and healing wounds without scarring. Politics determines the recipients of each.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : You gain the life when Heal the Scars resolves, not when the creature actually regenerates.

card.name: Hearthcage Giant
card.ability:
When Hearthcage Giant enters the battlefield, put two 3/1 red Elemental Shaman creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Sacrifice an Elemental: Target Giant creature gets +3/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The flamekin are mere kindling for his warmth.

card.name: Heat Shimmer
card.ability: Put a token that's a copy of target creature onto the battlefield. That token has haste and "At the beginning of the end step, exile this permanent."
card.flavor:
"Better to flare out than to gutter."
—Flamekin expression

card.name: Herbal Poultice
card.ability: {3}, Sacrifice Herbal Poultice: Regenerate target creature.
card.flavor:
"Apply orange leaf to a wound at dawn to clean it, at dusk to prevent the same injury from happening again."
—Kithkin superstition

card.name: Hillcomber Giant
card.ability: Mountainwalk
card.flavor: The giants believe the fossils they find in Lorwyn's rocky heights are dreams frozen in time, and they treasure them.

card.name: Hoarder's Greed
card.ability: You lose 2 life and draw two cards, then clash with an opponent. If you win, repeat this process. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

card.name: Hoofprints of the Stag
card.ability:
Whenever you draw a card, you may put a hoofprint counter on Hoofprints of the Stag.
{2}{W}, Remove four hoofprint counters from Hoofprints of the Stag: Put a 4/4 white Elemental creature token with flying onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your turn.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If a spell or ability has you draw multiple cards, Hoofprints of the Stag's ability triggers that many times.

card.name: Horde of Notions
card.ability:
Vigilance, trample, haste
{W}{U}{B}{R}{G}: You may play target Elemental card from your graveyard without paying its mana cost.
card.flavor: Even the oldest treefolk was but an acorn when Lorwyn's first mysteries were born.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : This ability does not allow you to pay the evoke cost of the targeted Elemental card.

card.name: Hornet Harasser
card.ability: When Hornet Harasser dies, target creature gets -2/-2 until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"And though she didn't get her honey, Auntie found something far more interesting."
—A tale of Auntie Grub
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : Hornet Harasser's ability is mandatory. If you're the only player who controls any creatures, you must give one of your own creatures -2/-2.

card.name: Hostility
card.ability:
Haste
If a spell you control would deal damage to an opponent, prevent that damage. Put a 3/1 red Elemental Shaman creature token with haste onto the battlefield for each 1 damage prevented this way.
When Hostility is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : If a spell you control would deal damage to an opponent and that opponent controls a planeswalker, that opponent chooses which of your effects to apply first. -- If that player chooses to apply Hostility's effect first, the damage is prevented, you put some tokens onto the battlefield, and the planeswalker redirection effect is moot because there's no damage to redirect. -- If that player chooses to apply the planeswalker redirection effect first, you have a choice. You can redirect the damage to the planeswalker (in which case Hostility's prevention effect is moot because nothing's dealing damage to the player anymore) or you can have your spell continue to deal damage to the opponent. If you choose the latter, Hostility's effect then applies, the damage is prevented, and you get the tokens.
10/1/2007 : The last ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into its owner's graveyard from any zone, not just from on the battlefield.
10/1/2007 : Although this ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it doesn't *specifically* trigger on leaving the battlefield, so it doesn't behave like other leaves-the-battlefield abilities. The ability will trigger from the graveyard.
10/1/2007 : If the Incarnation had lost this ability while on the battlefield (due to Lignify, for example) and then was destroyed, the ability would still trigger and it would get shuffled into its owner's library.  However, if the Incarnation lost this ability when it was put into the graveyard (due to Yixlid Jailer, for example), the ability wouldn't trigger and the Incarnation would remain in the graveyard.
10/1/2007 : If the Incarnation is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, it won't get shuffled into its owner's library. Similarly, if a replacement effect has the Incarnation move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.

card.name: Howltooth Hollow
card.ability:
Hideaway (This land enters the battlefield tapped. When it does, look at the top four cards of your library, exile one face down, then put the rest on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{B}, {T}: You may play the exiled card without paying its mana cost if each player has no cards in hand.

card.name: Hunt Down
card.ability: Target creature blocks target creature this turn if able.
card.flavor: "Springjacks and faeries can be difficult to hunt, but my favorite prey are the flamekin. They never fail to put up a worthy fight when cornered."
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If the first creature targeted by Hunt Down can't block the second targeted creature (for example, because the second creature has flying and the first doesn't, or because both creatures are controlled by the same player), the ability does nothing and the first creature is free to block whichever creature its controller chooses, or block no creatures at all.

card.name: Hunter of Eyeblights
card.ability:
When Hunter of Eyeblights enters the battlefield, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you don't control.
{2}{B}, {T}: Destroy target creature with a counter on it.
card.flavor: Snokk ran as fast as he could, but the sound of hooves grew ever louder in his ears.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : The activated ability can target a creature with any kind of counter on it, not just a +1/+1 counter.

card.name: Hurly-Burly
card.ability: Choose one — Hurly-Burly deals 1 damage to each creature without flying; or Hurly-Burly deals 1 damage to each creature with flying.
card.flavor:
"Things were popping like corn in a skillet. Olly landed in the pig pen with his prize sow on top of him, both squealin' like boggarts."
—Deagan, cenn of Burrenton

card.name: Immaculate Magistrate
card.ability: {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature for each Elf you control.
card.flavor: Elves of the immaculate class weave flora into living creatures—sometimes to endorse an elite warrior, sometimes to create a breathing work of art.

card.name: Imperious Perfect
card.ability:
Other Elf creatures you control get +1/+1.
{G}, {T}: Put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: In a culture of beauty, the most beautiful are worshipped as gods.

card.name: Incandescent Soulstoke
card.ability:
Other Elemental creatures you control get +1/+1.
{1}{R}, {T}: You may put an Elemental creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste until end of turn. Sacrifice it at the beginning of the next end step.

card.name: Incendiary Command
card.ability: Choose two — Incendiary Command deals 4 damage to target player; or Incendiary Command deals 2 damage to each creature; or destroy target nonbasic land; or each player discards all the cards in his or her hand, then draws that many cards.

card.name: Incremental Growth
card.ability: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature, two +1/+1 counters on another target creature, and three +1/+1 counters on a third target creature.
card.flavor:
"Tie a mouse under a bridge, and your cabbages will triple in size."
—Kithkin superstition
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : You must target three different creatures. If you can't, you can't cast Incremental Growth.

card.name: Ingot Chewer
card.ability:
When Ingot Chewer enters the battlefield, destroy target artifact.
Evoke {R} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)
card.flavor: Elementals are ideas given form. This one is the idea of "smashitude."
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters the battlefield trigger on the stack in either order.

card.name: Inkfathom Divers
card.ability:
Islandwalk
When Inkfathom Divers enters the battlefield, look at the top four cards of your library, then put them back in any order.
card.flavor:
"None appreciate sun and shallows like those who have seen the depths."
—Lianda of the Stonybrook school

card.name: Inner-Flame Acolyte
card.ability:
When Inner-Flame Acolyte enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.
Evoke {R} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters the battlefield trigger on the stack in either order.

card.name: Inner-Flame Igniter
card.ability: {2}{R}: Creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn. If this is the third time this ability has resolved this turn, creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor: A light an army can follow.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : Counts resolutions, not activations. Any such abilities that are still on the stack won't count toward the total.
10/1/2007 : When the ability resolves, it counts the number of times that same ability from that this creature has already resolved that turn. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or the previous abilities when they resolved. A copy of this ability (created by Rings of Brighthearth, for example) will count toward the total. Abilities from other creatures with the same name don't count towards the total. Neither does an ability that's been countered.
10/1/2007 : You get the bonus only the third time the ability resolves. You won't get the bonus the fourth, fifth, sixth, or any subsequent times.

card.name: Jace Beleren
card.ability:
+2: Each player draws a card.
-1: Target player draws a card.
-10: Target player puts the top twenty cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : If there are fewer than twenty cards in the targeted player's library, that player puts all the cards from his or her library into his or her graveyard.

card.name: Jagged-Scar Archers
card.ability:
Jagged-Scar Archers's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Elves you control.
{T}: Jagged-Scar Archers deals damage equal to its power to target creature with flying.

card.name: Judge of Currents
card.ability: Whenever a Merfolk you control becomes tapped, you may gain 1 life.
card.flavor: Though the currents of the Lanes shift every year, the merrow never lose track of where they are or where they are going.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : This is a triggered ability, not an activated ability. It doesn't allow you to tap the creature whenever you want; rather, you need some other way of tapping it, such as by attacking with the creature.
10/1/2007 : For the ability to trigger, the creature has to actually change from untapped to tapped. If an effect attempts to tap the creature, but it was already tapped at the time, this ability won't trigger.

card.name: Kinsbaile Balloonist
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Kinsbaile Balloonist attacks, you may have target creature gain flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: Even when a giant's tantrum turns the sky into a chaotic gale, the path of the balloonist never falters.

card.name: Kinsbaile Skirmisher
card.ability: When Kinsbaile Skirmisher enters the battlefield, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "If a boggart even dares breathe near one of my kin, I'll know. And I'll not be happy."

card.name: Kithkin Daggerdare
card.ability: {G}, {T}: Target attacking creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The kith dance their elaborate reels not merely to celebrate the events of their lives but to form an unbreakable bond of loyalty with their kin, a bond stronger than the fear of death itself.

card.name: Kithkin Greatheart
card.ability: As long as you control a Giant, Kithkin Greatheart gets +1/+1 and has first strike.
card.flavor: Sometimes a curious giant singles out a "little one" to follow for a few days, never realizing the effect it will have on the little one's life.

card.name: Kithkin Harbinger
card.ability: When Kithkin Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Kithkin card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
card.flavor: Her ears are open to even the softest voice.

card.name: Kithkin Healer
card.ability: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
card.flavor: The empathetic nature of the thoughtweft allows kithkin healers to treat the cause of an illness rather than fight its symptoms.

card.name: Kithkin Mourncaller
card.ability: Whenever an attacking Kithkin or Elf is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: Eidren's hunts are dangerous affairs. All dread the inevitable recounting of those who died while flushing out his prey.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If an attacking creature that's both a Kithkin and an Elf is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, Kithkin Mourncaller's ability triggers only once.

card.name: Knight of Meadowgrain
card.ability:
First strike
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
card.flavor: "By tradition, we don't speak for two days after battle. If our deeds won't speak for themselves, what else could be said?"

card.name: Knucklebone Witch
card.ability: Whenever a Goblin you control dies, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Knucklebone Witch.
card.flavor: Each bone honors its owner's best pranks.

card.name: Lace with Moonglove
card.ability:
Target creature gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy that creature.)
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"Which is more filled with poison: the flower of the moonglove or the minds of elves?"
—Vessifrus, flamekin demagogue
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : Deathtouch applies when any damage is dealt, not just when combat damage is dealt.

card.name: Lairwatch Giant
card.ability:
Lairwatch Giant can block an additional creature.
Whenever Lairwatch Giant blocks two or more creatures, it gains first strike until end of turn.
card.flavor: A giant can brood over a grudge for decades, and woe to those who interrupt him.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : Lairwatch Giant's second ability triggers if it blocks at least two creatures when blockers are declared. It will also trigger if it blocks fewer than two creatures when blockers are declared and effects then cause it to block more creatures. However, if Lairwatch Giant is already blocking two or more creatures, and effects then cause it to block more creatures, the ability won't trigger again.

card.name: Lammastide Weave
card.ability:
Name a card, then target player puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. If that card is the named card, you gain life equal to its converted mana cost.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: "A ribbon torn will ward away dark dreams."

card.name: Lash Out
card.ability: Lash Out deals 3 damage to target creature. Clash with an opponent. If you win, Lash Out deals 3 damage to that creature's controller. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

card.name: Leaf Gilder
card.ability: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Eidren, perfect of Lys Alana, ordered hundreds of trees uprooted and rearranged into a pattern he deemed beautiful. Thus the Gilt-Leaf Wood was born.

card.name: Lignify
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature is a 0/4 Treefolk with no abilities.
card.flavor: Bulgo paused, puzzled. What was that rustling sound, and why did he feel so stiff? And how could his feet be so thirsty?
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : Lignify overwrites characteristic-defining abilities that specify the enchanted creature's power or toughness (such as the one Dauntless Dourbark has) or that specify its creature types (such as changeling does).
10/1/2007 : Lignify will overwrite static abilities that come from the creature itself (such as the one on Verduran Enchantress) because Lignify causes the creature to lose that ability before it gets a chance to apply.
10/1/2007 : Lignify overwrites previous effects that changed the enchanted creature's creature types. Any such effects that apply after Lignify enters the battlefield will work normally.
10/1/2007 : Lignify causes the enchanted creature to lose all abilities it had at the time it became enchanted. Any abilities granted to the creature after Lignify entered the battlefield will work normally.
10/1/2007 : If a previous effect switched the creature's power and toughness, that effect still applies (though it will apply to the creature's new power and toughness).
10/1/2007 : If the enchanted creature has a characteristic-defining ability that specifies its color, that ability will still have its effect because it's applied before the creature loses the ability.
10/1/2007 : If Lignify leaves the battlefield, the creature goes back to being what it was before. Any effects that applied while the Lignify was on the battlefield, such as Giant Growth or Lace with Moonglove, will continue to apply.
10/1/2009 : Lignify will overwrite any previous effects that set the enchanted creature's power or toughness (such as Serendib Sorcerer does). Any such effects that apply after Lignify entered the battlefield will work normally.
10/1/2009 : Lignify will not overwrite effects such as those from Glorious Anthem, counters, or Giant Growth that change the enchanted creature's power or toughness without setting it to a specific value. Apply such effects after applying Lignify.

card.name: Liliana Vess
card.ability:
+1: Target player discards a card.
-2: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.
-8: Put all creature cards from all graveyards onto the battlefield under your control.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

card.name: Lowland Oaf
card.ability: {T}: Target Goblin creature you control gets +1/+0 and gains flying until end of turn. Sacrifice that creature at the beginning of the next end step.
card.flavor: "I don't know why the little one was so mad. He said to put him down, and I put him down."

card.name: Lys Alana Huntmaster
card.ability: Whenever you cast an Elf spell, you may put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: From the highest tiers of Dawn's Light Palace to the deepest shade of Wren's Run, the silver notes of the horn shimmer through the air, and all who hear it feel its pull.

card.name: Lys Alana Scarblade
card.ability: {T}, Discard an Elf card: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn, where X is the number of Elves you control.
card.flavor: In beauty-obsessed Lys Alana, one cut of her blade means the difference between a high society feast and raking through the dungheap for scraps.

card.name: Mad Auntie
card.ability:
Other Goblin creatures you control get +1/+1.
{T}: Regenerate another target Goblin.
card.flavor: One part cunning, one part wise, and many, many parts demented.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : The second ability can target any Goblin permanent except the Mad Auntie whose ability is being activated. It can target a different Mad Auntie.

card.name: Makeshift Mannequin
card.ability: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield with a mannequin counter on it. For as long as that creature has a mannequin counter on it, it has "When this creature becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it."
card.flavor:
"This vulgar mimicry will end now."
—Desmera, perfect of Wren's Run

card.name: Marsh Flitter
card.ability:
Flying
When Marsh Flitter enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 black Goblin Rogue creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Sacrifice a Goblin: Marsh Flitter becomes 3/3 until end of turn.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : The effect from the ability overwrites other effects that set power and/or toughness if and only if those effects existed before the ability resolved. It will not overwrite effects that modify power or toughness (whether from a static ability, counters, or a resolved spell or ability), nor will it overwrite effects that set power and toughness which come into existence after the ability resolves. Effects that switch the creature's power and toughness are always applied after any other power or toughness changing effects, including this one, regardless of the order in which they are created.

card.name: Masked Admirers
card.ability:
When Masked Admirers enters the battlefield, draw a card.
Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {G}{G}. If you do, return Masked Admirers from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: "Beauty determines value, and we determine beauty."

card.name: Merrow Commerce
card.ability: At the beginning of your end step, untap all Merfolk you control.
card.flavor: Schools meet and mingle on Lorwyn's riverways. In the bustling interplay, the merrow renew their sense of community as they sharpen their wits and hone their trading skills.

card.name: Merrow Harbinger
card.ability:
Islandwalk
When Merrow Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Merfolk card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

card.name: Merrow Reejerey
card.ability:
Other Merfolk creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you cast a Merfolk spell, you may tap or untap target permanent.
card.flavor: Steady and silent as the deep current, the reejerey guides the course of the school.

card.name: Militia's Pride
card.ability: Whenever a nontoken creature you control attacks, you may pay {W}. If you do, put a 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature token onto the battlefield tapped and attacking.
card.flavor: If you pick a fight with one kithkin, be ready to fight them all.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : The token enters the battlefield attacking. It doesn't trigger "when a creature attacks" triggers and is not subject to restrictions on declaring attackers.
10/1/2007 : You choose which player or planeswalker the token is attacking. It doesn't have to attack the same player or planeswalker as the creature that caused the ability to trigger.

card.name: Mirror Entity
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
{X}: Creatures you control become X/X and gain all creature types until end of turn.
card.flavor: Unaware of Lorwyn's diversity, it sees only itself, reflected a thousand times over.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : Activating the ability with X = 0 will cause all creatures you control to become 0/0 and be put into the graveyard.
10/1/2007 : Activating the ability for a second time in the same turn will overwrite the first activation. For example, if you activate the ability with X = 4, then activate it with X = 1, each of your creatures will be 1/1.
10/1/2009 : You apply power/toughness changing effects in a series of sublayers in the following order: (a) effects from characteristic-defining abilities; (b) effects that set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (c) effects that modify power and/or toughness but don't set power and/or toughness to a specific number or value; (d) changes from counters; (e) effects that switch a creature's power and toughness. This card's effect is always applied in (b), which means that effects applied in sublayer (c), (d), or (e) will not be overwritten; they will be applied to the new value.

card.name: Mistbind Clique
card.ability:
Flash
Flying
Champion a Faerie (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another Faerie you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)
When a Faerie is championed with Mistbind Clique, tap all lands target player controls.

card.name: Moonglove Extract
card.ability: Sacrifice Moonglove Extract: Moonglove Extract deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Diluted, moonglove can etch living tissue. Concentrated, a drop will kill a giant.

card.name: Moonglove Winnower
card.ability: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
card.flavor: Winnowers live to eliminate eyeblights, creatures the elves deem too ugly to exist.

card.name: Mosswort Bridge
card.ability:
Hideaway (This land enters the battlefield tapped. When it does, look at the top four cards of your library, exile one face down, then put the rest on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{G}, {T}: You may play the exiled card without paying its mana cost if creatures you control have total power 10 or greater.

card.name: Mournwhelk
card.ability:
When Mournwhelk enters the battlefield, target player discards two cards.
Evoke {3}{B} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)
card.flavor: It hoards Lorwyn's rare sorrows.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters the battlefield trigger on the stack in either order.

card.name: Mudbutton Torchrunner
card.ability: When Mudbutton Torchrunner dies, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: The oil sloshes against his skull as he nears his destination: the Frogtosser Games and the lighting of the Flaming Boggart.

card.name: Mulldrifter
card.ability:
Flying
When Mulldrifter enters the battlefield, draw two cards.
Evoke {2}{U} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)

card.name: Nameless Inversion
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
Target creature gets +3/-3 and loses all creature types until end of turn.
card.flavor: Just as a changeling's influence can have dramatic effects, so too can its sudden withdrawal.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If a creature loses all creature types but then gains a new creature type later in the turn, it will be that new creature type.

card.name: Nath of the Gilt-Leaf
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may have target opponent discard a card at random.
Whenever an opponent discards a card, you may put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: A savage hunter with a prince's bearing.

card.name: Nath's Buffoon
card.ability: Protection from Elves
card.flavor: Smik learned the elvish dance quickly enough. The most difficult, yet most important step was to stay out of Nath's sight until called to perform.

card.name: Nath's Elite
card.ability:
All creatures able to block Nath's Elite do so.
When Nath's Elite enters the battlefield, clash with an opponent. If you win, put a +1/+1 counter on Nath's Elite. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

card.name: Neck Snap
card.ability: Destroy target attacking or blocking creature.
card.flavor:
"We merrows need not be disadvantaged when fighting on land. We lack the vulnerability of those who breathe only through their throats."
—Minnarin, merrow reejerey

card.name: Nectar Faerie
card.ability:
Flying
{B}, {T}: Target Faerie or Elf gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
card.flavor:
"The unpredictable fae are just as likely to provide a blight as a boon."
—Desmera, perfect of Wren's Run
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If you grant lifelink to a creature controlled by another player, that other player will gain life when the creature deals damage.

card.name: Needle Drop
card.ability:
Needle Drop deals 1 damage to target creature or player that was dealt damage this turn.
Draw a card.
card.flavor:
"First it was plovers and mulldrifters. Now it's knitting needles the size of javelins."
—Calydd, kithkin farmer

card.name: Nettlevine Blight
card.ability:
Enchant creature or land
Enchanted permanent has "At the beginning of your end step, sacrifice this permanent and attach Nettlevine Blight to a creature or land you control."
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : Nettlevine Blight grants the triggered ability to the enchanted permanent, so "you" refers to that permanent's controller. The ability will trigger at the end of that player's turn, and that player chooses the new creature or land to attach Nettlevine Blight to. The player must choose a creature or land he or she controls.

card.name: Nightshade Stinger
card.ability:
Flying
Nightshade Stinger can't block.
card.flavor:
"Most faeries are harmless pranksters. Every now and again, though, you get one that crosses over from mischievous to malicious."
—Gaddock Teeg

card.name: Nova Chaser
card.ability:
Trample
Champion an Elemental (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another Elemental you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)

card.name: Oaken Brawler
card.ability: When Oaken Brawler enters the battlefield, clash with an opponent. If you win, put a +1/+1 counter on Oaken Brawler. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

card.name: Oakgnarl Warrior
card.ability: Vigilance, trample
card.flavor: "Roam as you will, your roots remain in the strong earth of your Rising."

card.name: Oblivion Ring
card.ability:
When Oblivion Ring enters the battlefield, exile another target nonland permanent.
When Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
card.flavor: A circle of sugar and a word of forbiddance.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : If Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and exile the targeted nonland permanent forever.
10/1/2007 : If there are no nonland permanents on the battlefield other than an Oblivion Ring, and the card it exiled was another Oblivion Ring, casting a third Oblivion Ring will result in an involuntary infinite loop that will end the game in a draw (unless someone chooses to break it by putting another nonland permanent onto the battlefield or destroying one of the Oblivion Rings, for example).
10/1/2008 : If the exiled card is an Aura, that card's owner chooses what it will enchant as it comes back onto the battlefield. An Aura put onto the battlefield this way doesn't target anything, but the Aura's enchant ability restricts what it can be attached to. If the Aura can't legally be attached to anything, it remains exiled forever.
7/1/2012 : Auras attached to the exiled permanent will be put into their owners' graveyards. Equipment attached to the exiled permanent will become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Any counters on the exiled permanent will cease to exist.

card.name: Oona's Prowler
card.ability:
Flying
Discard a card: Oona's Prowler gets -2/-0 until end of turn. Any player may activate this ability.
card.flavor: Deep in Glen Elendra blossoms Oona, queen of the faeries, nourished by secrets and pollinated by stolen dreams.

card.name: Paperfin Rascal
card.ability: When Paperfin Rascal enters the battlefield, clash with an opponent. If you win, put a +1/+1 counter on Paperfin Rascal. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

card.name: Peppersmoke
card.ability: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. If you control a Faerie, draw a card.
card.flavor: Like being trapped in a perpetual sneeze, faerie-dust poisoning is both exhilarating and agonizing.

card.name: Pestermite
card.ability:
Flash
Flying
When Pestermite enters the battlefield, you may tap or untap target permanent.
card.flavor: The fae know when they're not wanted. That's precisely why they show up.

card.name: Plover Knights
