card.ability: Flying, first strike
card.flavor: The knights are a major attraction at every Lammastide festival. Teams of riders perform daring feats of flight to the delight of all below.

card.name: Pollen Lullaby
card.ability: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn. Clash with an opponent. If you win, creatures that player controls don't untap during the player's next untap step. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

card.name: Ponder
card.ability:
Look at the top three cards of your library, then put them back in any order. You may shuffle your library.
Draw a card.
card.flavor: "We see the same sky as you, just through a different lens."
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If you choose to shuffle your library, that includes the three cards you just looked at and put back on top of it.

card.name: Primal Command
card.ability: Choose two — Target player gains 7 life; or put target noncreature permanent on top of its owner's library; or target player shuffles his or her graveyard into his or her library; or search your library for a creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

card.name: Profane Command
card.ability: Choose two — Target player loses X life; or return target creature card with converted mana cost X or less from your graveyard to the battlefield; or target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn; or up to X target creatures gain fear until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : The value chosen for X applies to each X in the spell's effect. You pay {X} only once.

card.name: Protective Bubble
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature is unblockable and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
card.flavor: Skilled merrow rudders ensure their charges arrive on time and without incident.

card.name: Prowess of the Fair
card.ability: Whenever another nontoken Elf is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may put a 1/1 green Elf Warrior creature token onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: An elvish duel is a thing of beauty: the warriors' grace, the crash of steel, then the artful spray of blood.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If Prowess of the Fair and another nontoken Elf are put into your graveyard simultaneously (by Akroma's Vengeance, for example), the other Elf will cause Prowess of the Fair's ability to trigger.

card.name: Purity
card.ability:
Flying
If noncombat damage would be dealt to you, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.
When Purity is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : The last ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into its owner's graveyard from any zone, not just from on the battlefield.
10/1/2007 : Although this ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it doesn't *specifically* trigger on leaving the battlefield, so it doesn't behave like other leaves-the-battlefield abilities. The ability will trigger from the graveyard.
10/1/2007 : If the Incarnation had lost this ability while on the battlefield (due to Lignify, for example) and then was destroyed, the ability would still trigger and it would get shuffled into its owner's library.  However, if the Incarnation lost this ability when it was put into the graveyard (due to Yixlid Jailer, for example), the ability wouldn't trigger and the Incarnation would remain in the graveyard.
10/1/2007 : If the Incarnation is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, it won't get shuffled into its owner's library. Similarly, if a replacement effect has the Incarnation move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.

card.name: Quill-Slinger Boggart
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a Kithkin spell, you may have target player lose 1 life.
card.flavor:
"A good day in Goldmeadow is one in which I don't spend all evening picking quills out of my backside."
—Calydd, kithkin farmer

card.name: Rebellion of the Flamekin
card.ability: Whenever you clash, you may pay {1}. If you do, put a 3/1 red Elemental Shaman creature token onto the battlefield. If you won, that token gains haste until end of turn. (This ability triggers after the clash ends.)

card.name: Rings of Brighthearth
card.ability: Whenever you activate an ability, if it isn't a mana ability, you may pay {2}. If you do, copy that ability. You may choose new targets for the copy.
card.flavor:
"Without flame, there would be no iron tools, no cooked meals, no purge of old growth to make room for new."
—Brighthearth creed
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : A mana ability is an ability that doesn't target and could put mana into a player's mana pool when it resolves.
4/15/2013 : A mana ability is an ability that (1) isn't a loyalty ability, (2) doesn't target, and (3) could put mana into a player's mana pool when it resolves.

card.name: Ringskipper
card.ability:
Flying
When Ringskipper dies, clash with an opponent. If you win, return Ringskipper to its owner's hand. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If Ringskipper is removed from the graveyard before the ability resolves, you still clash, but nothing will happen if you win.

card.name: Rootgrapple
card.ability: Destroy target noncreature permanent. If you control a Treefolk, draw a card.
card.flavor:
"All the sylvan secrets of this world are etched between my rings. The skinfolk's metal aberrations can rot between my roots."
—Colfenor, the Last Yew

card.name: Runed Stalactite
card.ability:
Equipped creature gets +1/+1 and is every creature type.
Equip {2}
card.flavor: When a changeling adopts a form no other changeling has taken, a rune appears in the caverns of Velis Vel to mark the event.

card.name: Scarred Vinebreeder
card.ability: {2}{B}, Exile an Elf card from your graveyard: Scarred Vinebreeder gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: For disfigured elves, there are few choices beyond death or nettlevine.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If you activate the ability, the Elf card is exiled as a cost. This action can't be responded to.

card.name: Scattering Stroke
card.ability: Counter target spell. Clash with an opponent. If you win, at the beginning of your next main phase, you may add {X} to your mana pool, where X is that spell's converted mana cost. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : You decide whether or not to add {X} to your mana pool as the delayed triggered ability resolves at the beginning of your next main phase. You don't decide before then.
10/1/2007 : You can't add just some of the mana to your mana pool. You either add all the {X} to your mana pool or none of it. All the mana you get this way is colorless.

card.name: Scion of Oona
card.ability:
Flash
Flying
Other Faerie creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other Faeries you control have shroud. (A permanent with shroud can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

card.name: Secluded Glen
card.ability:
As Secluded Glen enters the battlefield, you may reveal a Faerie card from your hand. If you don't, Secluded Glen enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Protected by glamers and guile, Glen Elendra harbors the elusive Oona, queen of the fae.

card.name: Seedguide Ash
card.ability: When Seedguide Ash dies, you may search your library for up to three Forest cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. If you do, shuffle your library.
card.flavor: "May you shade three generations of seedlings."

card.name: Sentinels of Glen Elendra
card.ability:
Flash
Flying
card.flavor: Some say the valley of Glen Elendra is mythical, and that rumors of its existence are nothing but a faerie prank. Others say it is the fae's most fiercely guarded secret.

card.name: Sentry Oak
card.ability:
Defender
At the beginning of combat on your turn, you may clash with an opponent. If you win, Sentry Oak gets +2/+0 and loses defender until end of turn. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : Specifically, this ability triggers when the beginning of combat step starts during your turn.

card.name: Shapesharer
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
{2}{U}: Target Shapeshifter becomes a copy of target creature until your next turn.
card.flavor: One good mimic deserves another.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : If the targeted Shapeshifter becomes an illegal target but the targeted creature doesn't, the ability will resolve but have no effect.
10/1/2007 : If the targeted creature becomes an illegal target but the targeted Shapeshifter doesn't, the Shapeshifter will still become a copy of the object. The effect will use the illegal target's current copiable characteristics if it's still on the battlefield, or its last known copiable characteristics if it has left the battlefield.
10/1/2007 : The copy effect doesn't wear off until just before your next untap step (even if an effect will cause that untap step to be skipped).
10/1/2007 : If Shapesharer itself becomes a copy of another creature, it loses both changeling and its activated ability (unless it's copying another creature with changeling and/or another Shapesharer, of course).
10/1/2007 : This ability can cause a creature to become a copy of itself. This will usually have no visible effect.
10/1/2007 : The targeted Shapeshifter copies the printed values of the targeted creature, plus any copy effects that have been applied to it. It won't copy counters on that creature. It won't copy effects that have changed the creature's power, toughness, types, color, and so on.
10/1/2007 : If the targeted Shapeshifter copies a creature that's copying a creature, it will become whatever the chosen creature is copying.
10/1/2007 : If the targeted Shapeshifter becomes a copy of a face-down creature, it will become a 2/2 creature with no name, creature type, abilities, mana cost, or color. It will not become face down and thus can't be turned face up.
10/1/2007 : Effects that have already applied to the targeted Shapeshifter will continue to apply to it. For example, if Giant Growth had given it +3/+3 earlier in the turn, then this ability makes it a copy of Grizzly Bears, it will be a 5/5 Grizzly Bears.

card.name: Shelldock Isle
card.ability:
Hideaway (This land enters the battlefield tapped. When it does, look at the top four cards of your library, exile one face down, then put the rest on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{U}, {T}: You may play the exiled card without paying its mana cost if a library has twenty or fewer cards in it.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : It doesn't matter which library has twenty or fewer cards in it, and you don't have to specify a library.

card.name: Shields of Velis Vel
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
Creatures target player controls get +0/+1 and gain all creature types until end of turn.
card.flavor: Changelings can alter shape based on what the beings around them desire most.

card.name: Shimmering Grotto
card.ability:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Once each year, the sun's rays reach the hidden chamber of Velis Vel, and the changelings congregate from afar to bathe in the ever-shifting light.

card.name: Shriekmaw
card.ability:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
When Shriekmaw enters the battlefield, destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature.
Evoke {1}{B} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters the battlefield trigger on the stack in either order.

card.name: Silvergill Adept
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Silvergill Adept, reveal a Merfolk card from your hand or pay {3}.
When Silvergill Adept enters the battlefield, draw a card.
card.flavor: "I bring baubles of lore, lost secrets seined from the listening waves."

card.name: Silvergill Douser
card.ability: {T}: Target creature gets -X/-0 until end of turn, where X is the number of Merfolk and/or Faeries you control.
card.flavor: The Silvergill school monitors traffic on the Lanes, ensuring that the riffraff don't interfere with travelers.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : A permanent that's both a Merfolk and a Faerie is counted only once when determining X.
10/1/2007 : The value of X is determined when Silvergill Douser's ability resolves. It won't change later, even if the number of Merfolk and/or Faeries you control changes.

card.name: Skeletal Changeling
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
{1}{B}: Regenerate Skeletal Changeling.
card.flavor: Though they lack true flesh and bone of their own, changelings imitate either with equal ease.

card.name: Smokebraider
card.ability: {T}: Add two mana in any combination of colors to your mana pool. Spend this mana only to cast Elemental spells or activate abilities of Elementals.
card.flavor: "Be silent and listen to your inner fire. Only then can you walk the Path of Flame."
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : The mana can be two mana of the same color, or one mana of each of two different colors. The mana can't be colorless.
10/1/2007 : You can use this mana to pay an alternative cost (such as evoke) or additional cost incurred while casting an Elemental spell. It's not limited to just that spell's mana cost.
10/1/2007 : The mana can't be spent to activate activated abilities of Elemental sources that aren't on the battlefield.

card.name: Soaring Hope
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When Soaring Hope enters the battlefield, you gain 3 life.
Enchanted creature has flying.
{W}: Put Soaring Hope on top of its owner's library.

card.name: Soulbright Flamekin
card.ability: {2}: Target creature gains trample until end of turn. If this is the third time this ability has resolved this turn, you may add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: When provoked, a flamekin's inner fire burns far hotter than any giant's forge.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : Soulbright Flamekin's ability uses the stack and can be responded to. It's not a mana ability because it has a target.
10/1/2007 : Counts resolutions, not activations. Any such abilities that are still on the stack won't count toward the total.
10/1/2007 : When the ability resolves, it counts the number of times that same ability from that this creature has already resolved that turn. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or the previous abilities when they resolved. A copy of this ability (created by Rings of Brighthearth, for example) will count toward the total. Abilities from other creatures with the same name don't count towards the total. Neither does an ability that's been countered.
10/1/2007 : You get the bonus only the third time the ability resolves. You won't get the bonus the fourth, fifth, sixth, or any subsequent times.

card.name: Sower of Temptation
card.ability:
Flying
When Sower of Temptation enters the battlefield, gain control of target creature for as long as Sower of Temptation remains on the battlefield.
card.flavor: One glamer leads him far from home. The next washes away his memory that home was ever anywhere but at her side.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : You retain control of the targeted creature as long as Sower of Temptation remains on the battlefield, even if a different player gains control of Sower of Temptation itself.
10/1/2007 : If Sower of Temptation leaves the battlefield before the ability resolves, the ability will have no effect.

card.name: Spellstutter Sprite
card.ability:
Flash
Flying
When Spellstutter Sprite enters the battlefield, counter target spell with converted mana cost X or less, where X is the number of Faeries you control.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : The value of X needs to be determined both when the ability triggers (so you can choose a target) and again when the ability resolves (to check if that target is still legal). If the number of Faeries you control has decreased enough in that time to make the target illegal, Spellstutter Sprite's ability will be countered (and the targeted spell will resolve as normal).

card.name: Spiderwig Boggart
card.ability: When Spiderwig Boggart enters the battlefield, target creature gains fear until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor: Auntie Flint was the first to pioneer the spiderwig, a mass of arachnids intended to be worn rather than eaten.

card.name: Spinerock Knoll
card.ability:
Hideaway (This land enters the battlefield tapped. When it does, look at the top four cards of your library, exile one face down, then put the rest on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
{R}, {T}: You may play the exiled card without paying its mana cost if an opponent was dealt 7 or more damage this turn.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : At the time the last ability resolves, you'll get to play the card if a player who is currently your opponent, or a player who was your opponent at the time he or she left the game, has been dealt 7 damage over the course of the turn.
10/1/2007 : It doesn't matter how the opponent was dealt damage or by whom, as long as the total damage is 7 or more. You don't specify an opponent when you activate the ability.
10/1/2007 : You'll get to play the card even if Spinerock Knoll wasn't on the battlefield at the time some or all of the 7 damage was dealt.

card.name: Spring Cleaning
card.ability: Destroy target enchantment. Clash with an opponent. If you win, destroy all enchantments your opponents control. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If you win the clash, you destroy all enchantments all of your opponents control, not just enchantments controlled by the opponent you clashed with.

card.name: Springjack Knight
card.ability: Whenever Springjack Knight attacks, clash with an opponent. If you win, target creature gains double strike until end of turn. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

card.name: Springleaf Drum
card.ability: {T}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.
card.flavor: After trying mudskippers for an afternoon, Scratch decided that crickcarp made the best noise.

card.name: Squeaking Pie Sneak
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Squeaking Pie Sneak, reveal a Goblin card from your hand or pay {3}.
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
card.flavor:
"Why do our pies squeak? It's all the faeries, mice, and prickly-hogs we stuff inside."
—Borb of the Squeaking Pie warren

card.name: Stinkdrinker Daredevil
card.ability: Giant spells you cast cost {2} less to cast.
card.flavor: Boggarts constantly strive to outdo each other with the things they bring back to the warren, each hoping the exploit will become as well-known as those of Auntie Grub.

card.name: Stonybrook Angler
card.ability: {1}{U}, {T}: You may tap or untap target creature.
card.flavor: "Water is in the air, the trees, and the earth. Understand its motion, speak its language, and the subtle currents that flow through all living things will fall under your command."

card.name: Streambed Aquitects
card.ability:
{T}: Target Merfolk creature gets +1/+1 and gains islandwalk until end of turn.
{T}: Target land becomes an Island until end of turn.
card.flavor:
"We look in the river and see scattered stones. A merrow looks and sees a map of Lorwyn."
—Illulia, flamekin soulstoke

card.name: Summon the School
card.ability:
Put two 1/1 blue Merfolk Wizard creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Tap four untapped Merfolk you control: Return Summon the School from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor:
"When merrows talk, listeners grow fins."
—Kithkin saying

card.name: Sunrise Sovereign
card.ability: Other Giant creatures you control get +2/+2 and have trample.
card.flavor: A hundred generations has he mentored, a hundred armies has he crushed beneath his feet, yet only a hundred words has he ever spoken, each more revered than a hundred books.

card.name: Surge of Thoughtweft
card.ability: Creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn. If you control a Kithkin, draw a card.
card.flavor: Kithkin weave together their very thoughts, creating a depth of cooperation unknown to other races.

card.name: Surgespanner
card.ability: Whenever Surgespanner becomes tapped, you may pay {1}{U}. If you do, return target permanent to its owner's hand.
card.flavor: They ride on waves of Æther, washing out anything that might pollute the Merrow Lanes.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : This is a triggered ability, not an activated ability. It doesn't allow you to tap the creature whenever you want; rather, you need some other way of tapping it, such as by attacking with the creature.
10/1/2007 : For the ability to trigger, the creature has to actually change from untapped to tapped. If an effect attempts to tap the creature, but it was already tapped at the time, this ability won't trigger.

card.name: Sygg, River Guide
card.ability:
Islandwalk
{1}{W}: Target Merfolk you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.
card.flavor: "If there's a place worth going, the Merrow Lanes already do. And if there's a route worth taking, yours truly already has."

card.name: Sylvan Echoes
card.ability: Whenever you clash and win, you may draw a card. (This ability triggers after the clash ends.)
card.flavor: It takes a huntmaster's eye to discern the contours of mythical prey.

card.name: Tar Pitcher
card.ability: {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Tar Pitcher deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"Auntie Grub had caught a goat, a bleating doe that still squirmed in her arms. At the same time, her warren decided to share with her a sensory greeting of hot tar . . . ."
—A tale of Auntie Grub

card.name: Tarfire
card.ability: Tarfire deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"After Auntie brushed the soot from her eyes, she discovered something wonderful: the fire had turned the goat into something that smelled delicious."
—A tale of Auntie Grub

card.name: Thieving Sprite
card.ability:
Flying
When Thieving Sprite enters the battlefield, target player reveals X cards from his or her hand, where X is the number of Faeries you control. You choose one of those cards. That player discards that card.

card.name: Thorn of Amethyst
card.ability: Noncreature spells cost {1} more to cast.
card.flavor: Mined from a cave in the Dark Meanders, it shines brightest when no one is looking.

card.name: Thorntooth Witch
card.ability: Whenever you cast a Treefolk spell, you may have target creature get +3/-3 until end of turn.
card.flavor: The crone's boughs creaked as she spoke. "You look peaked, little one. Come, sip from my warm brew. It'll have you blooming in no time."

card.name: Thoughtseize
card.ability: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card. You lose 2 life.
card.flavor: "Any dream is a robust harvest. Still, I prefer the timeworn dreams, heavy with import, that haunt the obsessive mind."

card.name: Thoughtweft Trio
card.ability:
First strike, vigilance
Champion a Kithkin (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another Kithkin you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)
Thoughtweft Trio can block any number of creatures.

card.name: Thousand-Year Elixir
card.ability:
You may activate abilities of creatures you control as though those creatures had haste.
{1}, {T}: Untap target creature.
card.flavor: Paradoxically, to tilt the massive jug for a sip, you'd need the energy of the giant's tonic.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : Thousand-Year Elixir doesn't actually grant haste to creatures you control, nor does it let you attack with them as though they had haste.

card.name: Thundercloud Shaman
card.ability: When Thundercloud Shaman enters the battlefield, it deals damage equal to the number of Giants you control to each non-Giant creature.
card.flavor: He cares not for the disasters his storm brings as long as his path ahead is clear.

card.name: Tideshaper Mystic
card.ability: {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn. Activate this ability only during your turn.
card.flavor: He paints with drop and shimmer a world that exists only in the wistful heart.

card.name: Timber Protector
card.ability:
Other Treefolk creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other Treefolk and Forests you control are indestructible.
card.flavor: In his presence, an ordinary grove becomes a bastion to turn spells and break armies.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : If Timber Protector somehow becomes a Forest, it doesn't make itself indestructible.

card.name: Treefolk Harbinger
card.ability: When Treefolk Harbinger enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a Treefolk or Forest card, reveal it, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it.

card.name: Triclopean Sight
card.ability:
Flash
Enchant creature
When Triclopean Sight enters the battlefield, untap enchanted creature.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has vigilance.

card.name: Turtleshell Changeling
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
{1}{U}: Switch Turtleshell Changeling's power and toughness until end of turn.
card.flavor: A changeling involuntarily mimics the nearest being at hand, sometimes trading a borrowed shell for borrowed claws.
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : Effects that switch power and toughness apply after all other effects that change power and/or toughness, regardless of which effect was created first.
4/15/2013 : Switching a creature’s power and toughness twice (or any even number of times) effectively returns the creature to the power and toughness it had before any switches.

card.name: Twinning Glass
card.ability: {1}, {T}: You may cast a nonland card from your hand without paying its mana cost if it has the same name as a spell that was cast this turn.
card.flavor: It takes two to craft a mirror: a practiced metalsmith to silver one side and her own hazy reflection to polish the other.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : Activating Twinning Glass's ability allows you to cast a single card from your hand as it resolves. It doesn't create a continuous effect, and it doesn't let you cast multiple cards for free.
10/1/2007 : It doesn't matter who cast the first spell.
10/1/2007 : You can't pay any alternative costs (such as those from evoke or morph) when casting the card. On the other hand, if the card has additional costs (such as those from kicker or buyback), you may pay those.
10/1/2007 : If one half of a split card has been cast this turn, you may use Twinning Glass's ability to cast either half of a split card with that name. For example, if Dead from Dead/Gone has been cast, you may use Twinning Glass's ability to cast either Dead or Gone.

card.name: Veteran of the Depths
card.ability: Whenever Veteran of the Depths becomes tapped, you may put a +1/+1 counter on it.
card.flavor: In the backwaters of the Merrow Lanes lie stones scarred with tallies of countless generations, each representing a victory of merrow soldiers.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : This is a triggered ability, not an activated ability. It doesn't allow you to tap the creature whenever you want; rather, you need some other way of tapping it, such as by attacking with the creature.
10/1/2007 : For the ability to trigger, the creature has to actually change from untapped to tapped. If an effect attempts to tap the creature, but it was already tapped at the time, this ability won't trigger.

card.name: Vigor
card.ability:
Trample
If damage would be dealt to a creature you control other than Vigor, prevent that damage. Put a +1/+1 counter on that creature for each 1 damage prevented this way.
When Vigor is put into a graveyard from anywhere, shuffle it into its owner's library.
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : The last ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into its owner's graveyard from any zone, not just from on the battlefield.
10/1/2007 : Although this ability triggers when the Incarnation is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, it doesn't *specifically* trigger on leaving the battlefield, so it doesn't behave like other leaves-the-battlefield abilities. The ability will trigger from the graveyard.
10/1/2007 : If the Incarnation had lost this ability while on the battlefield (due to Lignify, for example) and then was destroyed, the ability would still trigger and it would get shuffled into its owner's library.  However, if the Incarnation lost this ability when it was put into the graveyard (due to Yixlid Jailer, for example), the ability wouldn't trigger and the Incarnation would remain in the graveyard.
10/1/2007 : If the Incarnation is removed from the graveyard after the ability triggers but before it resolves, it won't get shuffled into its owner's library. Similarly, if a replacement effect has the Incarnation move to a different zone instead of being put into the graveyard, the ability won't trigger at all.

card.name: Vivid Crag
card.ability:
Vivid Crag enters the battlefield tapped with two charge counters on it.
{T}: Add {R} to your mana pool.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Crag: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Vivid Creek
card.ability:
Vivid Creek enters the battlefield tapped with two charge counters on it.
{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Creek: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Vivid Grove
card.ability:
Vivid Grove enters the battlefield tapped with two charge counters on it.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Grove: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Vivid Marsh
card.ability:
Vivid Marsh enters the battlefield tapped with two charge counters on it.
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Marsh: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Vivid Meadow
card.ability:
Vivid Meadow enters the battlefield tapped with two charge counters on it.
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{T}, Remove a charge counter from Vivid Meadow: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

card.name: Wanderer's Twig
card.ability: {1}, Sacrifice Wanderer's Twig: Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
card.flavor: For every tree who falls, there are countless sprouts waiting to rise.

card.name: Wanderwine Hub
card.ability:
As Wanderwine Hub enters the battlefield, you may reveal a Merfolk card from your hand. If you don't, Wanderwine Hub enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {W} or {U} to your mana pool.
card.flavor: Below the great river, a bustling hub channels the flow of merrow trade.

card.name: Wanderwine Prophets
card.ability:
Champion a Merfolk (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another Merfolk you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)
Whenever Wanderwine Prophets deals combat damage to a player, you may sacrifice a Merfolk. If you do, take an extra turn after this one.

card.name: Warren Pilferers
card.ability: When Warren Pilferers enters the battlefield, return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand. If that card is a Goblin card, Warren Pilferers gains haste until end of turn.
card.flavor: "What do they need all this stuff for? They're dead. We're alive. Simple enough."
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : The ability checks whether the targeted card is a Goblin when the ability resolves.
10/1/2007 : If the targeted card is removed from the graveyard before the ability resolves, the whole ability will be countered.

card.name: Warren-Scourge Elf
card.ability: Protection from Goblins
card.flavor:
"If one can associate any virtue with the eyeblights, it is the talent some achieve in disposing of them. I have seen the slaying of boggarts raised nearly to an art form."
—Fiala, Gilt-Leaf winnower

card.name: Weed Strangle
card.ability: Destroy target creature. Clash with an opponent. If you win, you gain life equal to that creature's toughness. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)

card.name: Wellgabber Apothecary
card.ability: {1}{W}: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to target tapped Merfolk or Kithkin creature this turn.
card.flavor: "You've discovered that boggarts bite, I see. And will the militia be chasing this lot? . . . Ah, you're staying in town to avoid Nath's hunt. Wise. Now this poultice . . ."
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : The targeted creature must be tapped when the ability is activated and when it resolves. It doesn't need to remain tapped in between.
10/1/2007 : Once the ability has resolved, all damage that would be dealt to that creature for the rest of the turn will be prevented, regardless of whether it's tapped or untapped at the time that damage would be dealt.

card.name: Whirlpool Whelm
card.ability: Clash with an opponent, then return target creature to its owner's hand. If you win, you may put that creature on top of its owner's library instead. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : You choose the target when you play Whirlpool Whelm, not when you clash.
10/1/2007 : If you don't win the clash, the targeted creature always goes to its owner's hand. If you win the clash, you choose whether the creature goes to its owner's hand or the top of its owner's library.
10/1/2007 : If you clash with the owner of the targeted creature and win, the owner of the creature decides where to put to card revealed during the clash before you decide whether to put the creature on top of that library. You know the player's decision before you make your decision.

card.name: Wild Ricochet
card.ability: You may choose new targets for target instant or sorcery spell. Then copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
card.flavor: "I knew that trick long before your great-grandmother's great-grandmother was born."
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : You copy the spell whether you choose new targets for it or not.
10/1/2007 : The targeted spell's controller retains control of that spell. You control the copy.
10/1/2007 : You may change any of the targeted spell's targets, or any of the copy's targets. If you change a target, you must choose a legal target for the spell. If you can't, you must leave the target the same (even if that target is now illegal).

card.name: Windbrisk Heights
card.ability:
Hideaway (This land enters the battlefield tapped. When it does, look at the top four cards of your library, exile one face down, then put the rest on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.
{W}, {T}: You may play the exiled card without paying its mana cost if you attacked with three or more creatures this turn.
card.ruling: 10/1/2007 : At the time the ability resolves, you'll get to play the card if you declared three different creatures as attackers at any point in the turn. A creature declared as an attacker in two different attack phases counts only once. A creature that entered the battlefield attacking (such as a token created by Militia's Pride) doesn't count because you never attacked with it.

card.name: Wings of Velis Vel
card.ability:
Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
Target creature becomes 4/4, gains all creature types, and gains flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: Changeling magic grants unusual wishes.

card.name: Wispmare
card.ability:
Flying
When Wispmare enters the battlefield, destroy target enchantment.
Evoke {W} (You may cast this spell for its evoke cost. If you do, it's sacrificed when it enters the battlefield.)
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If you cast this card for its evoke cost, you may put the sacrifice trigger and the regular enters the battlefield trigger on the stack in either order.

card.name: Wizened Cenn
card.ability: Other Kithkin creatures you control get +1/+1.
card.flavor: "Thoughtweft binds us together as one, part of an intricate pattern that would unravel if even one thread came loose."

card.name: Woodland Changeling
card.ability: Changeling (This card is every creature type at all times.)
card.flavor: Changelings cannot resist the draw of a new shape, even if doing so would be in their best interests.

card.name: Woodland Guidance
card.ability:
Return target card from your graveyard to your hand. Clash with an opponent. If you win, untap all Forests you control. (Each clashing player reveals the top card of his or her library, then puts that card on the top or bottom. A player wins if his or her card had a higher converted mana cost.)
Exile Woodland Guidance.

card.name: Wort, Boggart Auntie
card.ability:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may return target Goblin card from your graveyard to your hand.
card.flavor: Auntie always knows which berries to lick, which kithkin to trick, and what to do when either goes wrong.

card.name: Wren's Run Packmaster
card.ability:
Champion an Elf (When this enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you exile another Elf you control. When this leaves the battlefield, that card returns to the battlefield.)
{2}{G}: Put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield.
Each Wolf you control has deathtouch. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy that creature.)
card.ruling:
10/1/2007 : Wren's Run Packmaster gives deathtouch to all Wolf permanents you control, not just the tokens it creates.
10/1/2009 : A Wolf's deathtouch ability will apply if both Wren's Run Packmaster and that Wolf are on the battlefield at the time the Wolf deals damage. The creature dealt damage by the Wolf will be destroyed the next time state-based actions are checked, even if the Wolf or Wren's Run Packmaster leaves the battlefield.
